Sentence.sentence: "We're bringing new blood into the old, conventional farming ecosystem, which is really cool to see," Collins explains.

Sentence.sentence: When considering risk factors associated with serious chronic diseases, we often think about health indicators such as cholesterol, blood pressure, and body weight.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 血腥的, 嗜杀的, 有血的
stems_affixes.word_buile: blood血,流血+y……的→adj.血腥的, 嗜杀的, 有血的
blood血,流血→n.血, 血液, 血统

word_mean: 血，血液：在心脏、动脉、毛细血管和静脉内循环，并将营养物质和氧携带至体细胞的液体。它由浅黄色液体(血浆)构成，其中含有显微镜下可见的血液有形成分红细胞、白细胞和血小板
血雨，blood-rain  降水中含有红色物质而呈红色的雨。
血雪，blood-snow  降水中含有红色物质而呈红色的雪。
血容量传感器，blood-volume trans-ducer 能感受血容量并转换成可用输出信号的传感器。
免疫血型传感器，blood-group im-mune transducer 用固定化的A、B、O型血型物质制成的抗原膜作识别器件，将感受的血型信号转换成可用输出信号的传感器。
血压传感器， blood-pressure transduc-er 能感受血压并转换成可用输出信号的传感器。
血，行于脉中，并循环流注于全身，具有营养和滋润作用的红色液体。

Sentence.sentence: Take her for a walk, and she had no interest in Joe's blood counts or bone marrow test results.

Sentence.sentence: These hormones also have a positive effect on the heart and blood flow.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语四川卷 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: Laughter does produce short-term changes in the function of the heart and its blood vessels, boosting heart rate and oxygen consumption.

one is in a fighting mood

做牛做马的活；不懈的努力

jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指拳击比赛或决斗中的）最先见血

jx.jx_en_mean: the first point or advantage gained in a contest

lj.lj_ly: King &B{drew first blood} when he took the opening set.

ingrained in or fundamental to one's character

entry.def: Blood is the red liquid that flows inside your body, which you can see if you cut yourself.
You can use blood to refer to the race or social class of someone's parents or ancestors.

example.ex: There was Greek blood in his veins...
He was of noble blood, and an officer.
example.tran: 他出身贵族，是一名军官。

entry.def: If you say that there is bad blood between people, you mean that they have argued about something and dislike each other.

example.ex: There is, it seems, some bad blood between Mills and the Baldwins.
example.tran: 米尔斯和鲍德温一家人好像有些不和。

entry.def: If you say that people are baying for blood, you mean that they are demanding that someone should be hurt or punished.

example.ex: And so what will he say to those who have been baying for his blood?
example.tran: 那么，他又会对那些一直强烈要求制裁他的人说些什么呢？

entry.def: If you say that someone has blue blood, you mean that they are from a family that has a high social rank.
If you say that something makes your blood boil, you are emphasizing that it makes you very angry.
entry.tran: 使怒不可遏；使怒火中烧

example.ex: It makes my blood boil to think two thugs decided to pick on an innocent young girl.
example.tran: 一想到两个暴徒要欺负一个天真的小姑娘，我就满腔怒火。

entry.def: If something violent and cruel is done in cold blood, it is done deliberately and in an unemotional way.
entry.tran: 冷酷无情地；冷血地；残忍地

example.ex: The crime had been committed in cold blood.

entry.def: If you say that something makes your blood run cold or makes your blood freeze, you mean that it makes you feel very frightened.
entry.tran: 使人不寒而栗；令人毛骨悚然

example.ex: The rage in his eyes made her blood run cold...
example.tran: 他眼中的怒火吓得她汗毛倒竖。

example.ex: He could hear a sudden roaring. His blood froze.
example.tran: 他听到突如其来的一声吼叫，吓得魂不附体。

entry.def: If you say that someone has a person's blood on their hands, you mean that they are responsible for that person's death.
entry.tran: 手上沾了…的血；对…的死难辞其咎

example.ex: He has my son's  blood on his hands. I hope it haunts him for the rest of his days.
example.tran: 他手上沾了我儿子的血。我咒他余生不得安宁。

entry.def: If a quality or talent is in your blood, it is part of your nature, and other members of your family have it too.
entry.tran: 天生的；遗传的；生来就有的

example.ex: Diplomacy was in his blood: his ancestors had been feudal lords...
example.tran: 他天生擅长交际：他的祖先曾是封建领主。

example.ex: He has adventure in his blood.

entry.def: You can use the expressions new blood ,fresh blood, or young blood to refer to people who are brought into an organization to improve it by thinking of new ideas or new ways of doing things.
entry.tran: 新鲜血液；新生力量；新成员

example.ex: There's been a major reshuffle of the cabinet to bring in new blood...
example.tran: 内阁进行了重大改组，吸收了一些新鲜血液。

example.ex: The England selectors must start introducing young blood.
example.tran: 英格兰队的人才选拔委员会必须着手引入一些新生力量。

entry.def: If you say that doing something such as getting information or persuading someone to talk to you is like getting blood out of a stone or getting blood from a stone, you are emphasizing that it is very difficult and that people are not being very helpful. In American English, you can also say that it is like getting blood out of a turnip .
entry.tran: 向石取血，缘木求鱼（比喻很难办到或徒劳无功）

entry.def: If you say that someone sweats blood trying to do something, you are emphasizing that they try very hard to do it.

example.ex: I had to sweat blood for an M.A.
example.tran: 我得拼命争取获得硕士学位。

entry.def: If you say that someone draws first blood, you mean that they have had a success at the beginning of a competition or conflict.
entry.tran: 取得初步胜利；最先占上风

example.ex: The home side drew first blood with a penalty from Murray Strang.
example.tran: 主场球队依靠默里·斯特朗的罚球而旗开得胜。

entry.def: If you refer to something as involving blood, sweat, and tears, you mean that it is a very hard thing to do and requires a lot of effort.

example.ex: Why do apparently sane people go through all the blood, sweat, tears and heartache involved in getting a PhD?
example.tran: 为什么那些看起来神志正常的人会拼了命地要拿到一个博士学位？

entry.def: People say 'blood is thicker than water' when they mean that their loyalty to their family is greater than their loyalty to anyone else.
entry.tran: 血浓于水；家人总比外人亲

example.ex: Families have their problems and jealousies, but blood is thicker than water.
example.tran: 家家有本难念的经，也都难免互生嫉妒，但总归血浓于水。

means.word_mean: 1. the fluid (red in vertebrates) that is pumped by the heart;

sentences.sentence: "blood carries oxygen and nutrients to the tissues and carries waste products away"
"the ancients believed that blood was the seat of the emotions"

means.word_mean: 3. the shedding of blood resulting in murder;

sentences.sentence: "he avenged the blood of his kinsmen"

means.word_mean: 5. a dissolute man in fashionable society
6. people viewed as members of a group;

sentences.sentence: "we need more young blood in this organization"

means.word_mean: 1. smear with blood, as in a hunting initiation rite, where the face of a person is smeared with the blood of the kill

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  blōd, of Germanic origin; related to German Blut and Dutch bloed

sentences.en: The amount of sugar in tears changes proportionately with the blood authors explain.

sentences.cn: 一旦我的手指不按这动脉防止血液喷出,你就会死亡.
sentences.en: Only as long as I keep my finger upon this artery stop the blood gushing out.

sentences.cn: 血流阻力增加会使心肌增加波动强度以将血液输往全身.
sentences.en: This increased resistance causes the muscle work harder to pump the blood through these blood vessels.

sentences.cn: 当外部压力降低, 血液中形成气泡, 肺部会在几分钟内受损.
sentences.en: When the external pressure reduces, bubbles form in the blood, leading to lung damage within minutes.

sentences.cn: 简尼的血液试验重复做了3次.
sentences.en: Jenny's blood test was repeated three times.

sentences.cn: 哈维发现了血液的循环.
sentences.en: Harvey discovered the circulation of the blood.

sentences.cn: 你将要为此付出代价,用你仅有的血液.
sentences.en: You'll pay for this with every drop of your anemic blood.

sentences.cn: 潜水员还有一个发现.
sentences.en: The diver made another discovery.

sentences.cn: 提供氧气向血液供氧或加氧于 ( 血 )
sentences.en: To aerate or oxygenate ( blood ).

sentences.cn: 血液可沿主动脉向上或向下剥离动脉.
sentences.en: The blood can dissect up or down the aorta.

sentences.cn: 上面动画讲述了随着每次心脏的收缩和扩张,血液是如何流过心脏的.
sentences.en: The animation shows how blood flows through the heart as it contracts and relates.

sentences.cn: 在这些人睡着以后, 科学家往他们的血液中注入一种非常类似于乙酰胆碱的物质.
sentences.en: As the people slept, the scientists put into their blood a substance very similar to acetylcholine.

sentences.cn: 血液在我的血管里变得冰冷.
sentences.en: My blood ran chill in my veins.

sentences.cn: 血液把身体组织里的废物排出.
sentences.en: The blood exports waste products from the tissues.

sentences.cn: 红外+强力振动设计, 可促进血液循环, 加快新陈代谢.
sentences.en: The infrared + force vibration design, may promote the blood circulation, speeds up the metabolism.

sentences.cn: 血红蛋白是血液循环中输送氧的载体.
sentences.en: Hemoglobin was the carrier of oxygen in blood circulation.

sentences.cn: 心脏是一个天然泵,把血液输送到全身.
sentences.en: The heart is a kind of natural pump that moves the blood around the body.

sentences.cn: 血液在狭窄的远侧注入主动脉.
sentences.en: Blood flows into aorta distal to the stenosis.

sentences.cn: 他感到血液流向手臂.
sentences.en: He felt the blood run down his arm.

sentences.cn: 例如, 在水底环境里我们的血液能自我调节 吗 ?
sentences.en: For example, can our blood adjust itself to underwater surroundings?

sentences.cn: 如果动脉中的斑块破裂, 就可能会形成医学血液凝块.
sentences.en: If plaque in an artery ruptures or breaks open, blood clots may form.

sentences.cn: 净脉通就是这样地净化血液和正常化五脏六腑的运作.
sentences.en: Arterio will help to purify the blood and improve the functions of organs.

sentences.cn: 建立了离子色谱法测定血液样品中灭鼠剂氟乙酸钠的方法.
sentences.en: A method was developed for the determination of sodium monofluoroacetate in human blood by ion chromatography.

sentences.cn: 须帮老人轻巧地按摩身体,使老人血液循环畅通.
sentences.en: Massage the aged regularly for better blood circulator.

sentences.cn: 血小板是血液凝固的必须成分之一.
sentences.en: Platelets are one of the components required to make blood clot.

sentences.cn: 酒精能稀释血液,抑制堵塞动脉的血栓形成.
sentences.en: Alcohol thins the blood and prevents clots 12 that block arteries.

sentences.cn: 血液沿管子流入瓶中.
sentences.en: Blood flowed along the tube into the bottle.

sentences.cn: 他流血不止, 生命的火焰渐渐熄灭.
sentences.en: With the continued loss of blood , his life was steadily leaking away.

sentences.cn: 术士已经赢得了不少没有流血的胜利.
sentences.en: Wizards have won many a great victory spilling very little blood.

sentences.en: The other kind is called a hemorrhagic, or bleeding , stroke . This happens a blood vessel breaks.

sentences.cn: 先止住流血!

sentences.cn: 他们?有流血,但似乎被吓坏了.
sentences.en: There wasn't blood on them but they were so shocked.

sentences.cn: 不敢怎么样, 一年前偶总是这样,流血不断, 被小孩子戏弄.
sentences.en: Anyway, a year ago, I was always after blood, knocking kids around.

sentences.cn: 大鼓的声音是唯一不曾为流血与忙乱而改变的声音.
sentences.en: The drum's was the only voice in Saint Antoine that blood and hurry had not changed.

sentences.cn: 正是他,止住了流血 、 防止伤口恶化并生出新的皮肤.
sentences.en: It is he that coagulates the blood, stops the gash, and weaves the new skin.

Sentence.sentence: The authors documented an annual drop of as many as 120,000 cases of heart disease, 66,000 instances of stroke and 99,000 heart attacks caused by high blood pressure after a 3-g-per-day reduction in salt.
